medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 4 months previously, when he developed daily fevers, sweats, fatigue, impaired concentration, and weakness. Symptoms progressively worsened over several weeks, diminishing strength and preventing hiking, which he regularly did. He experienced fatigue when chewing and difficulty buttoning his shirt, along with distracting pain in his feet and calves.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary-artery bypass grafting 15 months prior, complicated by hernia; history of hepatitis B virus infection, gout, hyperlipidemia, hypertension, gastroesophageal reflux, and hypothyroidism.
medical_history.social_history: Retired engineer, lived in the Southwest, traveled to the Northeast to visit family, had worked in Vietnam 30 years prior, history of genital herpes infection, drank two glasses of wine nightly until stopping 3 months before presentation, no tobacco or illicit drug use.
